article.headline: Buffalo 80, N. Illinois 74
article.story: AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- -Yassin Idbihi's career-high 26 points helped Buffalo snap a five-game losing streak, defeating Northern Illinois 80-74 Saturday in the Mid-American Conference. Idbihi shot went 11-for-20 from the floor and grabbed six rebounds for Buffalo (10-12, 2-7). His bucket with 4:09 remaining gave the Bulls a 66-65 edge after Northern Illinois had rallied and gone up by four in a game with 10 lead changes. James Hughes led Northern Illinois (4-17, 1-8) with 20 points and six rebounds, while Ryan Paradise had 16 points and four rebounds. The Huskies trailed by as many as 10 before cutting the deficit in the first half. Paradise's long 3-pointer in the final minute sliced Buffalo's lead to 37-36 at halftime. Northern Illinois opened the second half with a run, taking a 44-39 lead before Parnell Smith (16 points, 8 rebounds) and Byron Mulkey (11 points) helped spur the Bulls' comeback. Buffalo outrebounded Northern Illinois 47-27, including 25-9 on the offensive boards. Northern Illinois shot 27-of-57 from the field (47.4 percent) while Buffalo was 29-69 (42 percent).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
